metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4461 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Jetty 8.1.0.RC2 and earlier computes hash values for form parameterswithout restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably,which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPUconsumption) by sending many crafted parameters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jetty - 6.1.26-1ubuntu1
libjetty-extra - 6.1.26-1ubuntu1
libjetty-extra-java - 6.1.26-1ubuntu1
libjetty-java - 6.1.26-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: jetty package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.26-1ubuntu1').
